newsitem.title: USA: Allergan says may use up R&D funds.
newsitem.headline: Allergan says may use up R&D funds.

text.p: Allergan Ligand Retinoid Therapeutics Inc said Friday that accelerated spending could deplete funds available to it for research and development in late 1997 or early 1998.

Such a depletion, it said, could trigger certain purchase options over its callable common stock and assets, but there is no assurance that the options would be exercised by Ligand Pharmaceuticals Inc and Allergan Inc.
The two companies perform research and development work for it under contract, it said.

Allergan Ligand announced a research and development plan for fiscal 1997 on January 31. The plan aimed at a more rapid discovery and development of a significantly larger library of viable retinoid compounds, it said.

The company said its expenses for research and development were $9.6 million in the second quarter ended June 30 and $19.1 million for the first six months of 1997. That compares with $6.8 million in the second quarter and $12.7 million in the first six months of 1996.
